B. RECOMMENDATIONS FOR LEGISLATIVE ENACTMENT
The Governor's Advisory Committee on Educational Television feels that the
potential for full and unrestricted use of television by all levels of the
schools in the State of California has great implications in the improvement
of instruction and in meeting the challenge presented by the rising costs of
education during a period of tremendous expansion. Existing legislation does
not permit full realization of this potential.
With this in mind, the Governor's Advisory Committee on Educational Television
recommends that legislation be drafted and introduced in the 1961 session of
the Legislature that will accomplish the following:
1. Education Code Sections 8857 and 23609 presently prohibit school districts,
the Department of Education and State Colleges from owning, leasing or
operating a television broadcast station, therefore;
It is recommended that the Education Code be amended to allow those entities
as named above to become owners and operators of television broadcasting staÂ¬
tions subject to the Rules and Regulations of the Federal Communications
Commission which provide in part that "non-comrnercial educational broadcast
stations will be licensed only to non-profit educational organizations upon
a showing that the proposed stations will be used primarily to serve the
educational needs of the community: for the advancement of educational programs
and to furnish a non-profit and non-commercial broadcast service."1
